intro: Tinopsis isoneura, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and white, fleshy berries. The plant lacks true roots and absorbs water and nutrients through its stems, which are embedded in the host's bark. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its presence can have both positive and negative effects on the health of its host tree.
